list_page_teaser: Do all hard-boiled PIs fit a certain psychological mold, or are their personalities as varied as any other loosely-knit groupof people?  Click to find out!
description_html:
A quick glance at the images below make it obvious that Private Investigators (PIs) do not fit into a certain psychological mold.

Moreover, temptation, tragedy, and ambiguous morality can happen to anyone, regardless of type!
story_html:
Once upon a time, I went into the Tattered Cover in Lodo to buy a technical book. (This was long ago, and I believe I was looking for something having to do with C++.)

While browsing, I came across a book entitled Film Noir Reader. Reading about the significance of these early films led to a life-long interest in the genre.

I plan to post more images of unforgettable characters from other movies soon.

To keep up to date, follow this site on social media or join the SeeOurMinds.com email list!

image_list.title: Mike Hammer
image_list.subtitle_html: PI in the film Kiss Me, Deadly
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: The X in this image shows that X is ....  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The X in this image represents X's dominant function, X.  In Introverts, the dominant function is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.
image_list.explain_aux: The X in this image represents X's auxiliary function, X.  In Introverts, the auxiliary function is directed outwardly and is more evident than the dominant function.
